thread.title: Emma Stone was holding her Best Actress card the "entire time" - so how did Oscars gaffe really happen?
thread.title_full: Emma Stone was holding her Best Actress card the "entire time" - so how did Oscars gaffe really happen?

author: Vicki Newman
title: Emma Stone was holding her Best Actress card the "entire time" - so how did Oscars gaffe really happen?
text:
Get celebs   
It's the moment everyone is talking about, and Emma Stone has revealed exactly how she feels about missing out on Best Picture at the Oscars - after originally believing she'd won. 
The actress took to the stage with co-star Ryan Gosling to collect the coveted prize at the 88th Academy Awards, only to be told that they hadn't actually won it. 
Hollywood legends Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway announced La La Land as the winner, when it was actually Moonlight which took the top prize home. 
So painfully awkward! Read More Emma took home the Best Actress prize (Photo: REUTERS) And the winner is... or isn't... (Photo: AFP) 
Viewers immediately started speculating exactly how it happened, with some believing the presenters were handed the wrong card by producers. 
Some thought they were actually holding the card that announced Emma as the winner of Best Actress in a Leading Role for La La Land, and therefore read out that film by mistake. 
But Emma has revealed that that couldn't possibly be the case. 
Holding her Best Actress award, Emma spoke out backstage. She can't stop looking at her award (Photo: Rex Features) She was presented her prize by Leonardp DiCaprio (Photo: Getty) 
She said: "Okay, so yes of course, I'm an actor, so I've always dreamt of this kind of thing, but yet again, not in a realistic context. 
"And for that, I f***ing love Moonlight, God I love Moonlight so much! I'm so excited for Moonlight and of course it was an amazing thing to hear La La Land, I think we all would have loved to win Best Picture, but we are so excited for Moonlight, I think it's one of the best films of all time, so I was pretty beside mysef. 
"I also was holding my Best Actress in a Leading Role card that entire time. So whatever story, I don't mean to start stuff, but whatever story that was, I had that card. So I'm not sure what happened and I really wanted to talk to you guys first." 
Other fans summised the Oscars was hacked. Either way, it is a huge embarrassment for all involved. Read More They hug it out (Photo: Rex Features) Video Loading
